body: Merge it into master if there're no more discussions
did you open this by accident? please close this?
LGTM!
This is ready for review

@prabhjyotsingh Thanks for explanation. I have tried with  https://github.com/cloudera/hue/tree/master/apps/spark/java and LivyInterpreter works greatly.
However, still no luck with https://github.com/cloudera/livy. i'm getting the same error.

@Leemoonsoo can you try one of this

`curl -X POST --data '{"kind": "spark", "master": "local[*]", "proxyUser": "null"}' -H "Content-Type: application/json" localhost:8998/sessions` if trying on https://github.com/cloudera/hue/tree/master/apps/spark/java 

or 

`curl -X POST --data '{"kind": "spark", "conf":{"spark.master": "local[*]"},"proxyUser": "null"}' -H "Content-Type: application/json" localhost:8998/sessions` if on https://github.com/cloudera/livy.

Most likely this is known issue https://github.com/apache/incubator-zeppelin/pull/827/commits/3deca713f638e8908974c45891d4ed152a55cda9#diff-427ba78b970ccdf0a95f5176f693a377R88 and your server is running from https://github.com/cloudera/livy.

or if it is something else can you paste the output, so I can try the same to debug and fix.

@prabhjyotsingh Thanks for the help. Commenting out spark.master from https://github.com/cloudera/livy/conf/spark-blacklist.conf made it work.

Looks good to me!

@Leemoonsoo thanks a lot for reviewing it.

CI fails for unrelated issue at Job #4237.1
CI is green, ready for review.
LGTM
LGTM
Merging this if no more discussion.

Every jar under interpreter/spark/ supposed to be included in the classpath by [interpreter.sh#67](https://github.com/apache/incubator-zeppelin/blob/master/bin/interpreter.sh#L67). So i expect this PR does not change any behavior. @elbamos if you find any case that jar is not loaded in this way, please file an issue.

Merge if there're no more discussions.

Is there anything else I need to do from my end?  Thanks

@AhyoungRyu Thanks for this change. I am happy to see this doc improvement.

But I think we have an issue with authentication performed by upstream servers ( (e.g NGINX/Oracle HTTP Server, Apache WebServer,...)

In reviewing this pull request I looked at existing NGINX authentication doc and I can't find any instructions to propagate identity from NGINX to Zeppelin.

If we allow any upstream server to authenticate, the next step is to have the identity authenticated upstream to be propagated to Zeppelin and have Zeppelin use that identity for it's own access control decisions and Zeppelin should then send this identity downstream to submit jobs.

I am happy to file another JIRA to track this, please advise.

Huge 👍  for tests and test notebooks.

Looks great to me modulo minor comments above.

The build finally succeeded. I have created a jira issue with flaky-test label. Is it ok to merge #860 and #856?
This PR is a very trivial. Merging if there's no more discussion.

I tested this funtionality but I got failed.

[My test process]
1. I removed `interpreter/md` path 
2. start zeppelin server
3. request following curl command 

```
curl -H "Content-Type: application/json"  -XPOST "http://127.0.0.1:8080/api/interpreter/load/md/markdown" -d '{
  "artifact": "org.apache.zeppelin:zeppelin-markdown:0.6.0-incubating-SNAPSHOT",
  "className": "org.apache.zeppelin.markdown.Markdown",
  "repository": {
    "url": "http://dl.bintray.com/spark-packages/maven",
    "snapshot" : true
  }
}'
```

but I got an exception and md is not loaded. 
The exception is following

Just FYI, the documentation for this feature was already written in here :  [https://zeppelin.incubator.apache.org/docs/0.6.0-incubating-SNAPSHOT/manual/dynamicinterpreterload.html](https://zeppelin.incubator.apache.org/docs/0.6.0-incubating-SNAPSHOT/manual/dynamicinterpreterload.html)

I hope this docs can help any others who want to review this PR :)

@prabhjyotsingh Thank you for the bug. Fixed this using standard ISO time format. Tested with different time zones.
![screen shot 2016-05-23 at 5 38 50 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12127192/15470274/55c6cb16-210d-11e6-9dd7-e17a43fd6eef.png)

![screen shot 2016-05-23 at 5 42 02 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12127192/15470344/c466e3e4-210d-11e6-8ec5-819a5139c410.png)

This also changes the time format (customizable in code) at statement "last updated by xx at <time>".
![screen shot 2016-05-23 at 5 16 25 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12127192/15470100/f69cd2e4-210b-11e6-9a47-403ac54b85d7.png)

Added moment.js : Now, took xx seconds text will show as per moment.js [documentattion](http://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/fromnow/). Same is the case for elapsed time.
![screen shot 2016-05-23 at 5 25 34 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12127192/15470129/2594acfc-210c-11e6-87ee-90b3bb98e474.png)
![screen shot 2016-05-23 at 5 25 49 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12127192/15470127/25939060-210c-11e6-846e-3ce3ac4b9839.png)
![screen shot 2016-05-23 at 5 30 33 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12127192/15470128/2593d2a0-210c-11e6-9a34-5d277fa6934f.png)
